title: Solana Price Prediction: Any Bullish Upswing 'Unlikely' - Watcher Guru
content:
The recent regulatory scrutiny in the United States has had a detrimental effect on many top-performing crypto tokens. One of the most impacted projects is Solana (SOL). Although SOL is up 2% over the last week, the asset has fallen 28.6% in the previous 14 days. Moreover, it is down by 23.5% in the monthly charts.

Solana (SOL) took a hit in particular, along with Polygon (MATIC) Cardano (ADA), and some others, as it is named in the SEC‘s (Securities and Exchange Commission) lawsuit against Coinbase. The U.S. SEC alleged that Coinbase sold unregistered securities, named SOL, ADA, MATIC, etc. Having been listed in the suit has given rise to fears among investors that these tokens might face delisting in the near future.

It should be noted that Solana (SOL) has risen by 55.02 % since Jan 1, 2023. The token was trading at $9.96 at the beginning of the year. Since then, it has risen to $15.44 as of press time.

Will Solana reclaim $20 anytime soon?

Solana (SOL) was trading above $20 for most of this year. In fact, it was only after the SEC’s crusade did the popular asset fell to current levels.

SOL is currently facing resistance at $15.88, with support at $14.99. If current resistance levels are broken, SOL could face fresh resistance at around $17.40. SOL had previously reached this level on Mar. 10, 2023. However, if current support levels are breached, SOL could fall to around $14.08, a level last seen in early January of this year.

Solana (SOL) is a development-rich project. It has frequently topped lists and leaderboards for having the most development going on. This is a solid metric to keep track of for future growth. A network that has proper development activity, might see additional value in the future.

However, with that being said, SOL is currently facing a period of uncertainty as it is being called unregistered security by the top financial authority of the U.S. Until there are clearer rules on what defines security in the crypto space, SOL might continue to see a cloud of uncertainty. At press time, SOL was trading at $15.46, down by 0.8% in the last 24 hours.

title: Solana Delisted Again. MillionaireGame Coin (MG) Shows Bonk Who's Boss - Tribune Online
content:
Solana has faced a series of delisting actions after the SEC declared it as a security. Financial service provider Robinhood has already removed all such identified tokens, including Solana. Now, cryptocurrency trading platform Bakkt has also decided to delist Solana due to regulatory uncertainty.

Community Concern for Bonk’s Future

Due to these challenges for Solana, the community is now worried about Bonk, the leading meme coin on the Solana network. Bonk (BONK) is down over 65% this month. This decline has spurred concerns within the meme coin community about the future of Solana. Amid this uncertainty, MillionaireGame Coin (MG), a new meme coin, has emerged as a promising contender for substantial growth.

MillionaireGame: The New Millionaire Maker

MillionaireGame Coin (MG), backed by community support, promises the creation of a new millionaire each month from amongst its token holders, with the chance of winning being proportional to the amount of tokens held. Investors who have bought MG have a chance to significantly multiply their modest investments, an attractive proposition for meme coin enthusiasts.

$MG Presale: Early-Bird Opportunity

To distribute MG amongst early contributors, a presale plan for MG is currently underway. MG’s price is projected to rise consistently during the presale event. After this, MG will be issued on the Ethereum mainnet and listed on top-tier exchanges.

MillionaireGame Coin (MG)’s Transparent, Long-term Game

To ensure transparency, the team uses smart contracts to enforce the games fairness. MillionaireGame Coin (MG)’s token supply is capped. And per the token’s design, the game can continue for over 50 years.

Related Reading: Memecoin Game for Creating New Millionaires?

Solana Faces Multiple Delistings

Solana has now been delisted by both the Robinhood and Bakkt trading platforms. These decisions followed SEC’s lawsuits against Coinbase and Binance for allegedly selling unregistered securities, including Solana, Cardano, and Polygon. Such delisting affects these tokens’ liquidity and emphasizes the need for comprehensive cryptocurrency regulations.

While Solana grapples with regulatory uncertainty, MillionaireGame Coin (MG) capitalizes on the opportunity to showcase its potential and solidify its position in the meme coin scene. The unfavorable situation for Bonk, combined with the promising rise of MG, invites Bonk users to consider MG as a viable and potentially lucrative investment alternative.

MillionaireGame (MG)

Website: https://www.millionairegame.net/

Presale: https://www.millionairegame.net/claim-discount

title: Investing In Zebec Protocol (ZBC) – Everything You Need to Know - Securities.io
content:
Blockchain technology made a promise 13 years ago to revolutionize the way payments work. And, while many were skeptical at the time, these days, we are witnessing that promise being fulfilled in real-time. Of course, we are still very far away from mass adoption, but the number and diversity of all kinds of solutions that are emerging throughout the blockchain industry is really making people believe that there is something to the promises that the blockchain made when Bitcoin first came out.

Of course, the realization of the promise is somewhat different from what was expected back then. Initially, everyone believed that the promise meant that Bitcoin would become a worldwide-adopted currency, legal tender everywhere, and the coin that will be used for all sorts of payments. Today we know that this is not the case and that it cannot be the case. There are too many limitations to Bitcoin, and the project is very slow to change, which is why it is taking on a new role as digital gold.

However, there are 19,000 other cryptocurrencies out there at the time of writing, and some of those actually have the potential to change the way payments work. Take Zebec Protocol as an example. It is a continuous settlement protocol that aims to transform things like payroll, cash flow, and token vesting by allowing users to send payments and distributions every second. This got us interested, which is why we decided to take a deeper look into what it has to offer.

What Problems Does Zebec Protocol (ZBC) Solve?

First, we decided to see what impact can the project have on the world, and what issues it plans to solve with its technology. We found that it does things such as:

Enabling payment streams

Zebec is a Solana-based project that acts as a continuous settlement protocol Its goal is to enable the composable transfer of value, starting with its main service called Zebec Payroll. The project is also very user-friendly, and it claims that users can get started in only two steps — by connecting their wallets and starting the money stream.

Enabling DeFi revolution

One of Zebec Protocol’s goals is to enable the DeFi revolution. DeFi made a lot of noise when it emerged, and it attracted a lot of people with its promises of earning passive income while helping out other members of the community simply by locking up the tokens they own. However, DeFi can also be applied to change the way things are done in traditional finance, including things like payrolls.

Bringing change in the digital economy of Web3

Zebec Protocol stands as modular money, layer, which is extensible and upgradeable through governance. Apart from pursuing a DeFi revolution, it also aims to bring change in the WEb3 digital economy by establishing programmable money streaming as a foundation for better, greater, and “more legendary” financial innovations.

Benefits of Zebec Protocol (ZBC)

With that said, let’s take a look at some of the benefits that you can personally experience if you decide to join this project.

Treasury management

To start things off, we have treasury management. Essentially, the project uses multi-signature approach to manage crypto treasury, meaning that you can expect advanced security of funds and that no one can take them away on their own.

Instant and continuous funds streaming

When it comes to funds streaming, it is of crucial importance that it continues to flow uninterrupted at all times. This is why Zebec ensures that the funds stream is on a per-second basis and that you have full control over it, with the ability to pause it, resume it, or cancel it at any time.

High customization

The team behind the project understands that different businesses have different requirements, and that there is no “one size fits all” when it comes to this sort of thing. This is why it allows you to customize Multisig for all custom workflows, no matter how many of them, or what you need them to be like.

Access multiple tokens

Treasury management is not only for the project’s native ZBC token, either. In fact, it supports all SPL tokens. In other words, it is compatible with any and all tokens issues on Solana’s blockchain, so no matter which coin or token you prefer, the project will be able to offer services to you.

Yield farming and staking

The project also offers more than just the funds streaming, as it also recognizes the importance of DeFi to individual users. This is why it offers yield farming, where users can allocate some, or even all of their earnings to an investment account and arrange for the funds to be automatically deployed into partner yield farming and staking protocols.

Crypto IRA & 401k Accounts

Investing in crypto in the long term is one of the best investment strategies there is. This is why many people are choosing to invest in them now, years, or even decades before retirement. Zebec Protocol understands this also, which is why it allows users to stream their payroll to compliant crypto IRA & 401k accounts. Not only that, but they can also easily swap between top cryptocurrencies, which allows them to modify their investment as new coins emerge, or as others become more profitable.

Custom debit card

Finally, the project also understands that users need more than simply the ability to store crypto or be paid in it, which is why it offers a custom crypto debit card that will allow employees to seamlessly convert their real-time liquidity to fiat currency and use it in everyday life. At the time of writing, this feature is not yet available, but the project says that it is working on it, and that custom debit cards will be coming soon.

How Does Zebec Protocol (ZBC) Work?

Zebec Protocol is a revolutionary DeFi technology aimed at empowering businesses and their employees alike. It offers real-time, frictionless and continuous streams of payments, where the automatic money streams are made possible via Zebec’s advanced technology.

With them, businesses, employees, and consumers can completely reimagine the way payments and salaries work, as well as investments, purchases of products, and payments for services. The project’s mission is to allow direct and instant financial transaction settlements between the involved parties, with no needs for intermediaries, but also with no difficulties, long waiting periods, large transaction fees, and alike.

Simply put, it wishes to disrupt the current, traditional financial system and allow DeFi to change the payments world and expand its use cases and reach into traditional finance, instead of existing outside of it.

How to Buy Zebec Protocol (ZBC)

Currently, Zebec Protocol (ZBC) is available for purchase on the following exchanges.

KuCoin – This exchange currently offers cryptocurrency trading of over 300 other popular tokens. It is often the first to offer buying opportunities for new tokens. This exchange currently accepts International & United States residents.

Gate.io – This exchange was established in 2013, and is one of the more popular & reputable exchanges. Gate.io currently accepts most international jurisdictions including Australia & the UK. USA & Canada residents are prohibited.

HTX – Established in 2013, HTX has since become one of the world’s largest digital asset exchanges, with an accumulated trading volume of US $1 trillion. It should be noted that HTX currently does not accept USA or Canadian residents.

Zebec Protocol (ZBC) — Multisig treasury management and streaming payments protocol

Zebec Protocol is a project that can change the way businesses work and pay their employees forever, but also the things that these employees will do with their money, and how they do it. Whether you wish to use your payments for investments into various coins and tokens, if you wish to deposit them in an IRA account for retirement, or even if you wish to spend it — the project offers all of this, and more. As such, it can push adoption into the business sector, and help people save time and money by offering near-instant transactions at cheap transaction costs, and alike. We believe that a project like this can go a long way once crypto and blockchain reach mass adoption, which is why entering it now could have positive consequences for the users’ financial future.
